Hi!

I have uploaded a new version, eco-0.3.tar.gz & eco-0.3-winbin.tar.gz,=
 to the file area, see Changelog for changes. The winbin package contains a=
n executable for windows, cross compiled on linux. The other package is the=
 complete source.

Below is some info about eco from README.

/Magnus


The=
re are four separate populations that are learning how to fly in a world wi=
th gravity. The goal has been too teach them to follow the blue light sourc=
e in the middle of the screen (press 'm' to auto move light source, right m=
ouse button to move it), but that goal is yet to be accomplished. The units=
 awareness of the light source has been turned off since it is not yet work=
ing.

Each unit have 6 rays measuring the distances to the walls, press 'r'=
 too see the rays of the current champion. They also know their orientation=
 in the world. _eval_unit() in eco.c contains the fitness calculations and =
input/output stuff. They have two outputs: thrust & turn angle. Each tick t=
hey can turn maximum, +-8 degrees, and add maximum 0.03 to their current mo=
ve speed. The red flame (zoom with '+''-', or scrollwheel on linux) is the =
current thrust that tick, press 'p' to pause and 'space' to step while paus=
ing. Press 'f' after zooming to return to original view.

Press 'd' to see =
some debug information in the lower left corner. First is the current numbe=
r of ticks passed. Second value is the number of ticks/second that are eval=
uated, press 'w' too speed things up a bit. Next three values are the movin=
g average of number of crashes/tick, calculated for the last 1000, 5000, an=
d 15000 ticks.

Remove world.map before starting to have an empty map. Use =
left mouse
button + shift to paint walls. Erase walls with right mouse butt=
on + shift. Undo last wall with 'u' (buggy). Use 's' to save map (world.map=
) and the current genomes (pops.gnm). Remove pops.gnm before starting to cl=
ear what they have learned.

Hack the code and change the definition of _NP=
OPS to 1 (eco.c) to only have one population, to speed things up. Change th=
e definition of _NUNITS to have less units in each population for more spee=
d. Remove pops.gnm before starting if these values are changed.

Note that =
the activation routine is different from the original implementation of rtN=
EAT. I might in the future implement it in the same way as the original.


=
